posts.post_content: Bad card is bad. But sometimes, a bad card gets to define a cost and P/T. 1/2's for 2 are [Squire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Squire)s. 2/2's for 2 are Bears ([Grizzly Bears](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grizzly Bears)). 2/2's for 3 are [Gray Ogre](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gray Ogre)s and so on.
posts.html:
Bad card is bad. But sometimes, a bad card gets to define a cost and P/T. 1/2's for 2 are Squires. 2/2's for 2 are Bears (Grizzly Bears). 2/2's for 3 are Gray Ogres and so on.

posts.post_content: I pulled a *foil* Squire back in the days of time spiral. At first i was upset for getting a poopy card in my foil slot, but soon, he grew on me. One of my most favorite sentimental cards. Sometimes he's my 15th card in a sideboard just for \*\*\*. 2/5 Stars
posts.html:
I pulled a foil Squire back in the days of time spiral. At first i was upset for getting a poopy card in my foil slot, but soon, he grew on me. One of my most favorite sentimental cards. Sometimes he's my 15th card in a sideboard just for ***. 2/5 Stars

Posted By: Haelthor (12/16/2012 10:27:57 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
If I remember correctly they had two reasons for including this card.  
  
1. To show that not every card was great back then (The power level of Timeshifted cards is pretty high on average compared to a normal set)  
  
2. To also show how they used to use quotes from other works of fiction outside of Magic
posts.html:
If I remember correctly they had two reasons for including this card.

1. To show that not every card was great back then (The power level of Timeshifted cards is pretty high on average compared to a normal set)

2. To also show how they used to use quotes from other works of fiction outside of Magic
